fr.sii.ogham.sms.builder.ovh

Class OvhSmsBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.core.fluent.AbstractParent<SmsBuilder>
      • fr.sii.ogham.sms.builder.ovh.OvhSmsBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Builder<OvhSmsSender>, Parent<SmsBuilder>

    public class OvhSmsBuilder
extends AbstractParent<SmsBuilder>
implements Builder<OvhSmsSender>
    Configures how to send Sms using OVH HTTP API.

    To send Sms using OVH, you need to register this builder into a MessagingBuilder like this: 

     
 MessagingBuilder msgBuilder = ...
 msgBuilder.sms()
    .sender(OvhSmsBuilder.class)    // registers the builder and accesses to that builder for configuring it
    Once the builder is registered, sending sms through OVH requires URL, account, login and password values. You can define it using: 
     
 msgBuilder.email()
    .sender(OvhSmsBuilder.class)    // registers the builder and accesses to that builder for configuring it
       .url("https://www.ovh.com/cgi-bin/sms/http2sms.cgi")
    Or you can also use property keys (using interpolation): 
     
 msgBuilder
 .environment()
    .properties()
       .set("custom.property.for.url", "https://www.ovh.com/cgi-bin/sms/http2sms.cgi")
       .and()
    .and()
 .email()
    .sender(OvhSmsBuilder.class)    // registers the builder and accesses to that builder for configuring it
       .url()
        .properties("${custom.property.for.url}")
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Method Detail

      • url

        public OvhSmsBuilder url(URL url)
        Set the URL of the OVH SMS HTTP API.

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using url(). 

         .url(new URL("http://localhost"))
 .url()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(new URL("https://www.ovh.com/cgi-bin/sms/http2sms.cgi"))
 
         .url(new URL("http://localhost"))
 .url()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(new URL("https://www.ovh.com/cgi-bin/sms/http2sms.cgi"))
        In both cases, url(new URL("http://localhost")) is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        url - the url for Ovh HTTP API
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

        IllegalArgumentException - when URL is not valid

      • url

        public ConfigurationValueBuilder<OvhSmsBuilder,URL> url()
        Set the URL of the OVH SMS HTTP API.

        This method is mainly used by Configurers to register some property keys and/or a default value. The aim is to let developer be able to externalize its configuration (using system properties, configuration file or anything else). If the developer doesn't configure any value for the registered properties, the default value is used (if set). 

         .url()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(new URL("https://www.ovh.com/cgi-bin/sms/http2sms.cgi"))

        Non-null value set using url(URL) takes precedence over property values and default value. 

         .url(new URL("http://localhost"))
 .url()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(new URL("https://www.ovh.com/cgi-bin/sms/http2sms.cgi"))
        The value new URL("http://localhost") is used regardless of the value of the properties and default value.

        See ConfigurationValueBuilder for more information.

        Returns:
        the builder to configure property keys/default value

      • account

        public OvhSmsBuilder account(String account)
        Set the OVH account identifier.

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using account(). 

         .account("my-account")
 .account()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("default-account")
 
         .account("my-account")
 .account()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("default-account")
        In both cases, account("my-account") is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        account - the account identifier
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • account

        public ConfigurationValueBuilder<OvhSmsBuilder,String> account()
        Set the OVH account identifier.

        This method is mainly used by Configurers to register some property keys and/or a default value. The aim is to let developer be able to externalize its configuration (using system properties, configuration file or anything else). If the developer doesn't configure any value for the registered properties, the default value is used (if set). 

         .account()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("default-account")

        Non-null value set using account(String) takes precedence over property values and default value. 

         .account("my-account")
 .account()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("default-account")
        The value "my-account" is used regardless of the value of the properties and default value.

        See ConfigurationValueBuilder for more information.

        Returns:
        the builder to configure property keys/default value

      • options

        public OvhOptionsBuilder options()
        Configures OVH SMS options:
        • Enable/disable the "STOP" indication at the end of the message (useful to disable for non-commercial SMS)
        • Define the SMS encoding (see SmsCoding): 1 for 7bit encoding, 2 for 8bit encoding (UTF-8). If you use UTF-8, your SMS will have a maximum size of 70 characters instead of 160
        • Define a tag to mark sent messages (a 20 maximum character string)
        Returns:
        the builder to configure OVH SMS options

      • build

        public OvhSmsSender build()
